TITLE: DeSantis on climate: 'Human beings are safer than ever'
Biden and Mary Barra are buds. It could affect the strike.
SUMMARY: CEO Mary Barra is helping Biden unleash waves of electric cars. That could color how the White House responds to the UAW strike.

TITLE: How Elon Musk could win the UAW strike
SUMMARY: Tesla’s continued dominance on electric cars would undermine Biden’s hopes of basing the next generation of cars and trucks on unionized labor.

TITLE: Lack of policy makes extreme heat too hot to handle
UAW strike could disrupt EV rollout. Environmentalists support it anyway.
SUMMARY: The green support for the union marks a relatively new development between two Democratic-aligned factions.

TITLE: UAW to strike at 3 plants at midnight, barring deal
SUMMARY: The strike will initially target GM’s Wentzville Assembly plant in Missouri, Stellantis’ Toledo Assembly in Ohio and Ford’s Michigan Assembly in Wayne, Mich.

TITLE: Michigan Democrats sweating UAW strike threat
SUMMARY: A strike involving thousands of workers could send tremors through Biden's hopes for reelection, and his efforts to cut U.S. carbon emissions.

TITLE: ‘Abandoned by the Democratic Party’: Behind the UAW’s frustrations with Biden
SUMMARY: A United Auto Workers strike against the big U.S. automakers would pose tangible and political problems for the president's push for electric vehicles.

TITLE: Extremists keep trying to trigger mass blackouts — and that’s not even the scariest part
SUMMARY: Extremist groups are among those targeting the electricity network, exposing the reporting gaps between the state and federal agencies that oversee its security.

TITLE: Trump's border wall caused 'significant' cultural, environmental damage, watchdog finds
SUMMARY: The 450 miles of barrier waived or disregarded environmental and historic preservation laws and interfered with endangered species, diverted water sources and caused other environmental damage, GAO said.

TITLE: The Great Salt Lake is shrinking rapidly, and Utah has failed to stop it, a lawsuit contends
SUMMARY: The plaintiffs want a court to force the state to let more water reach the largest natural lake west of the Mississippi River.

TITLE: Biden blocks oil drilling on 10M acres in Alaska, including leases Trump sold
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump had bragged about his success in opening the region to oil production after decades of political fighting over the resources locked under the tundra there.

TITLE: States withhold cooling aid for the poor as heat gets deadlier
SUMMARY: Many states refuse to use money from a federal program to help low-income people pay for cooling bills or repairs.

TITLE: As Africa opens a climate summit, poor weather forecasting keeps the continent underprepared
SUMMARY: The vast expanse of the 54-nation African continent is relatively unserved and unwarned.

TITLE: How the power grid survived a hot, hot summer
SUMMARY: The power system has held up so far in record-breaking temperatures despite predictions that extreme heat could cause a crash. Here's why.

TITLE: The summer from hell was just a warning
SUMMARY: This summer's string of record-breaking disasters is a window into the future.

TITLE: FEMA forced to restrict disaster spending because of low funds
SUMMARY: From now on, the money will be used only for “critical response efforts” and not rebuilding.

TITLE: Idalia power outages spread across the South
SUMMARY: Outages are most widespread in the sparsely populated counties of the northern Gulf Coast, while the capital of Tallahassee has so far largely escaped major power impacts.

TITLE: Hurricane heads for state still recovering from 2022 storm
SUMMARY: An "extremely dangerous" Hurricane Idalia is projected to bring lethal flooding and winds to a low-income, poorly insured region of Florida.

TITLE: How a steaming Gulf is powering Idalia’s threat to Florida
SUMMARY: Both the Gulf of Mexico and the larger Atlantic Ocean basin have seen record heat this summer. That's hurricane fuel.

TITLE: The U.S. is pumping oil faster than ever. Republicans don't care.
SUMMARY: GOP presidential candidates are blaming pump prices on President Joe Biden’s clean energy policies, even though the U.S. is churning out record amounts of oil.

TITLE: ‘The heat’s different now’: Why the U.S. was unprepared for a deadly summer
SUMMARY: Extreme temperatures across the U.S. have put the elderly, outdoors workers and people with no access to cool air at greatest risk of severe heat-related illnesses or even death.

TITLE: Biden faces calls to declare climate emergency as he heads to Maui
SUMMARY: Climate groups and many of the president’s allies in Congress urge him to invoke emergency powers to mitigate environmental threats.

TITLE: Maui town ravaged by fire will ‘rise again,’ Hawaii governor says of long recovery ahead
SUMMARY: The seaside town will be rebuilt as a living memorial to those lost.

TITLE: Why the latest abortion pill ruling has enviros rolling their eyes
SUMMARY: Courts have said that people who like plants and animals can sue when wildlife is harmed. People who "delight" in fetuses should have the same right, a Trump-appointed judge wrote.

TITLE: Wealthy oil nation lays groundwork for ‘eye-popping’ climate fund
SUMMARY: The United Arab Emirates has drawn a backlash from climate advocates for its role hosting the global climate talks, but the massive fund it's considering would help countries green their economies.

TITLE: Electric cars face 'punitive' fees, new restrictions in many states
SUMMARY: A growing number of conservative states are imposing new taxes on drivers using electric vehicle charging stations and trying to limit EV sales.

TITLE: Big costs, sweeping changes: What to know about the IRA
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden and Democrats have hailed the law as climate-game changer, but its popularity with companies is proving expensive as it speeds the transition to clean energy economy.

TITLE: How a Republican president could hobble the climate law
SUMMARY: The GOP may be unable to undo Democrats' top recent achievement, but a Republican president can wreak havoc with its implementation.

TITLE: Biden celebrates as climate law marks first year
SUMMARY: Biden signed the sweeping Inflation Reduction Act into law one year ago Wednesday. It includes roughly $370 billion to help shift the U.S. to cleaner forms of power.
